intro: Relbunium corymbosum, commonly known as the clustered bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, which includes many bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its flowers are usually blue or violet, with a tubular shape and five lobes. Relbunium corymbosum is characterized by its clustered inflorescence and is often found in dry, calcareous soils.
